Title: Sr. Software Engineer, E-Commerce
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a Software Engineer on our E-Commerce team to help scale Peloton's $1+ billion e-commerce channel. This Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for growing and executing the technical roadmap of innovative features by partnering with your peers in product management, design, marketing, member support, international teams, etc. You should have a passion for the technical and operational excellence, and relentlessly championing best practices in a continuously evolving and dynamic environment.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Help to evolve our platform to best in class by providing guidance to the teams in terms of technical strategy and excellency.
 API development experience with a variety of languages.
Develop on modern front-end web technologies, architectures, and building high performant user-friendly experiences on the web.
Write understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability, scalability and performance.
Drive cross-team dependencies and design docs to help promote a culture of learning and constant improvement.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

 5+ years of software development experience.
Strong product and technical mindset.
Proven experience with Sprint Boot (or Spring), Java, Postgres, AWS, GraphQL, Docker, Kubernetes.
Have experience with Next, React and Typescript.
Ability to contribute consistently and positively in a high-paced, fast-changed environment.
Passionate about technology, new ideas, and always willing to learn new things.
Analytical and creative problem solver, with the flexibility to accommodate evolving business needs.
Expert understanding of object-oriented and/or functional programming design principles.
Good understanding of Agile, Lean, DevOps, and SRE principles.
Acute attention to detail and dedication to quality.

BONUS POINTS IF YOU

Have experience working within e-commerce. 3+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Have experience integrating and deploying to managed cloud infrastructure (AWS or GCP).
Have experience with microservices architecture and the backend-for-frontend pattern.
Are able to take a project from scoping requirements through actual execution and delivery.
Attend meetups, conferences, and participate in the software engineering community.
Contribute to open-source projects.
Have experience migrating a monolithic system to an ecosystem of microservices.
Have experience with or knowledge of TDD, DDD, CQRS and Event Sourcing.
Worked on a system that had to deal with internationalization and localization.

Title: Sr. Creative Director, Voice and Copy
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Were seeking a talented and visionary Senior Creative Director, Voice and Copy to lead our team of copywriters and shape the voice of the brand across all platforms. Reporting to the VP, Creative, this role will oversee the development of high-quality, compelling copy that resonates with our audience, enhances brand recognition, and drives business growth. This role will collaborate closely with creative, marketing, content, and product teams to ensure consistency and innovation in messaging across all channels and campaigns.  
This is a unique opportunity for a strategic thinker with a passion for storytelling and brand voice development, capable of transforming concepts into clear, persuasive, and engaging copy.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON:

Develop a comprehensive copy strategy that aligns with the overall brand vision of Peloton, ensuring a unified voice across all channels, content and campaigns.
Lead and mentor a team of copywriters, ensuring their work aligns with the brand's voice, tone, and overall strategy  and produces high-quality, impactful copy.
Exhibit exceptional copywriting, editing and proofreading skills, ensuring all content is polished, engaging and on-brand.
Own the development of copy across a wide range of channels, including digital, social media, email, web and print.
Collaborate closely with marketing, creative, content and design teams to deliver cohesive and impactful messaging that supports key campaigns, launches, and initiatives.
Partner with Product and Legal teams to ensure all copy adheres to legal and ethical standards, maintaining brand integrity and compliance.
Ensure brand consistency by maintaining and evolving the brand voice across all communication touchpoints, while adapting the tone to different audiences and formats.
Drive innovation in copy, staying on top of trends in the industry and constantly refining approaches to connect with consumers more effectively.
Review and edit content produced by the team to maintain high standards of quality, clarity, and engagement.
Partner with cross-functional teams to integrate copy that aligns with marketing goals, enhances customer experience, and drives conversion.
Manage workflows and deadlines for the copy team, ensuring timely and effective delivery of projects.
Measure and analyze the performance of copy-driven initiatives, using insights to guide future strategies and optimizations.
Set prioritization for the team in partnership with Creative Ops, ensuring that projects are executed efficiently and deadlines are consistently met.
Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration and continuous improvement within the copy team, encouraging innovation and professional growth.
Provide strong copywriting feedback and a clear point of view to guide the team and elevate brand messaging.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

15+ years of experience in copywriting and voice development, with a focus on digital, social, and integrated campaigns.
Proven experience in leading copy teams and developing compelling brand messaging.
Mastery in crafting and delivering compelling copy with exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Cultural obsession that keeps you on the pulse of emerging technology, art forms, and entertainment.
Inspired, sharp, and customer-obsessed thinking
Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to inspire a team to deliver their best work.
A deep understanding of brand strategy, tone of voice, and storytelling.
Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills, with the ability to work across multiple formats and platforms.
Experience in working proactively and collaboratively with creative and marketing teams to ensure integrated and cohesive messaging.
Strong organizational and project management skills to handle multiple projects with competing deadlines.
A growth mindset and a passion for pushing creative boundaries to continuously improve performance and engagement.
Agility in fast paced environments, with a proven ability to navigate ambiguity, solve complex problems and drive innovation within copy.

Title: Sr. Counsel, Corporate Securities and Governance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Peloton is looking for a motivated, dynamic attorney with 7+ years of experience at a top law firm or in-house legal department to join our corporate legal team. As Senior Counsel, you will be primarily responsible for supporting Pelotons senior attorneys, Finance and People teams on all matters related to our public filings, securities law compliance, capital markets transactions, investor relations and Board and committee matters. 
 This role requires a strong understanding of Pelotons multifaceted business, including relationships with key stakeholders such as our members, suppliers, and partners, to help achieve our business objectives. This role will be based out of our New York City headquarters office and will be required to comply with our hybrid policy. Currently, hybrid team members report to the office weekly on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.
 
YOUR IMPACT AT PELOTON:

Serve as the main legal contact for the Financial Reporting team in preparing and reviewing SEC filings (Form 10-K, 10-Q). 
Lead preparation and analysis of proxy statements, Form 8-K, related party transactions, director and officer questionnaires, and corporate compliance calendars.
Oversee administration of Pelotons Insider Trading Policy and 10b5-1 plans, and prepare reports of beneficial ownership for officers and directors on Forms 3, 4 and 5. 
Review external communications, including press releases, investor presentations, and other announcements in collaboration with Investor Relations and Communications teams.
Draft agendas, resolutions and minutes for Board and committee meetings.
Partner with the People team on Compensation Committee agenda items and related executive compensation, equity issuances, and public reporting matters.
Stay informed on governance trends, SEC and Nasdaq regulations, and industry best practices, presenting insights to the Nominating, Governance and Corporate Responsibility Committee.
Collaborate with Investor Relations on Regulation FD compliance, investor engagement, and Pelotons annual stockholder meeting.
Support ESG initiatives, public disclosures and corporate governance matters. 
Develop and maintain policies and procedures related to securities law compliance and risk management, while working closely with internal audit on SOX compliance.
Assist Treasury and Accounting teams with credit facilities and other financing arrangements, and participate in capital markets transactions.
Handle special projects as needed, adapting to a fast-paced,evolving environment.
Build strong relationships with Legal, Finance, People and senior business teams to drive operational efficiencies.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

7+ years experience in SEC reporting or securities law compliance and advisory work at a top law firm and/or in-house role (in-house experience preferred).
Expertise in corporate and securities law, particularly SEC and Nasdaq rules and regulations.
Exceptional communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
Business-savvy with the ability to provide strategic legal advice.
Strong team player with a willingness to take on a range of responsibilities (no job is too small or too large).
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Member in good standing of the NY, CA, or comparable State Bar.

Our Teams mission is to ensure our instructors consistently reach their full potential as the best instructors in the world. We support them to reflect our brand values, operate with efficiency, and contribute meaningfully to our company and member culture. We manage the unique challenges and pressures of on-air performance with empathy and professionalism and take a solutions-oriented approach to everything we do.

Title: Sr. Manager, Global Lifecycle and Engagement Marketing
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a results-oriented Senior Manager, Member Lifecycle & Engagement to play a key role in driving member engagement and brand happiness. Reporting to the Senior Director, Membership Strategy & Engagement, this leadership role will focus on executing and optimizing member communications strategies, improving member satisfaction, and ensuring alignment with broader business goals. You will lead a team that focuses on implementing effective initiatives to engage members at every touchpoint, using data-driven insights to manage an evergreen calendar, lean into automation, and drive owned channels (email, push, in-app, sms, hardware notifications). If you are passionate about lifecycle marketing, member engagement, and retention, and have proven experience executing large-scale strategies, we encourage you to apply.
YOUR IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead end-to-end member engagement strategy, developing impactful and data-informed lifecycle communications that foster connection and community across themember journey  from onboarding through long-term brand advocacy.
Own and evolve the member onboarding experience, partnering with Product, Content, and Creative to deliver dynamic, high-performing series that drive early activation and set the foundation for long-term engagement.
Drive channel-specific engagement strategies across Email, Push, In-App, SMS, and Hardware Notifications. Prioritize personalization, timeliness, and tone, using experimentation and automation to maximize channel impact.
Analyze and optimize engagement campaigns with a focus on how communications influence key member behaviors, including class frequency, content exploration, feature adoption, and habit formation.
Collaborate cross-functionally with Brand, Content, Creative, and Community teams to tell compelling stories that celebrate member milestones, highlight instructor-led content, and reinforce brand identity.
Lead storytelling and brand-building initiatives that spotlight real member journeys, reinforce Pelotons values, and foster a sense of belonging across diverse audiences.
Build and manage an evergreen engagement calendar, proactively surfacing key seasonal, cultural, and content moments to deepen emotional connection and excitement around Peloton's offerings.
Champion a culture of experimentation by testing new messaging formats, cadence strategies, and cross-channel engagement tactics. Leverage insights to inform creative direction and strategic planning.
Mentor and lead a high-performing engagement team, fostering professional development, collaborative thinking, and a member-first mindset. Ensure alignment around shared KPIs and team goals.
Report regularly on campaign performance and engagement health, synthesizinginsights into actionable next steps. Partner with analytics to define success metrics and evaluate impact on business and brand objectives.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5-6 years of experience in retention marketing, lifecycle/CRM roles, or similar, with a track record of managing comprehensive campaigns across digital channels such as email, SMS, and push notifications.
3-5 years of experience leading and mentoring teams, including managing and guiding direct reports to meet strategic objectives and improve performance.
Familiarity with the subscription business model and a deep understanding of the customer lifecycle. Extensive experience within the retention space.
Production and implementation of direct marketing programs across digital channels - email, SMS, in-app, push notifications. Experience with a physical hardware product a plus.
Strong working knowledge of marketing automation platforms such as Braze, Salesforce, Litmus, or similar tools. Proficiency in HTML and a deep understanding of best practices in email and digital design.
Solid understanding of data analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tableau, Excel, etc.) and ability to analyze campaign performance, derive insights from data, and adapt strategies to optimize results.
Exceptional attention to detail and a rigorous approach to measuring and improving marketing performance.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and other key stakeholders. 
Strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative, team-oriented approach to working across functions.
Proven ability to lead and inspire a cross-functional team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Demonstrated experience managing and developing a team, including mentoring junior and mid-level team members and planning for their professional growth.
Ability to navigate and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization, drivingalignment around shared goals.

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
As a Senior Analyst, Service & Repair Systems you will lead critical operational aspects of Pelotons service and repair business. RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is an award-winning health and fitness brand that builds connected products and experiences that matter. YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Design and develop large-scale fitness equipment and manage the development of the integrated subsystems and member input devices.
Work closely with Product Management, Mechanical Engineering, UX Testing, and Software to develop engaging fitness equipment for our members.
End-to-end product development from research and early concept exploration, to product DFM and launch.
Make design decisions for a product and/or component and show/explain how those decisions were made.

Troubleshoot technical challenges with cross-functional partners and vendors to maintain design intent.
Actively engage the team in discussions and foster healthy design debates and mediate conversations between functions to help drive toward decisions.
Own and drive presenting your work - carefully crafting your presentations based on understanding your target audience.
Facilitate brainstorms within your design team to stimulate creative thinking and capture ideas.
Simultaneously work across 2+ projects at various stages of development - leading and supporting workstreams as needed.
Specify CMF for all user-facing parts and ensure production parts meet design and CMF requirements

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

You have a proven understanding of the Product Development Process and are beginning to specialize in one or more areas of design. Your work is complex, and well thought out.
You lead sophisticated projects with direction from program leaders and input from cross- functional partners.

5+ years of relevant work experience
Highly proficient in analog and digital sketching with compelling sketch/rendering skills

Proficient in Keyshot
Proficient in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
Experience using Google Docs, Slides, Sheets (or equivalent)

BONUS

Fitness industry experience
Advanced surfacing with Solidworks or other parametric modeling software
Personal interest in wellness or fitness

Title: Facilities Technician
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
As the Facilities Technician at Peloton, you will serve as the onsite lead for all facilities-related operations. This role ensures that the building runs smoothly, with a focus on maintaining a safe, clean, and well-functioning workspace for all Peloton employees and members. You will be responsible for coordinating with vendors, tracking preventive maintenance, and maintaining clear communication with both the Workplace Experience team and Facilities Leadership. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Perform daily walk-throughs for quality control, ensuring that studios are clean, well-stocked, and in top condition.
Conduct physical inspections of the facility, including grounds, common areas, restrooms, and studio spaces. Identify areas needing repairs or maintenance, and assign vendors to resolve issues.
Track and report any necessary repairs, maintenance needs, or safety concerns to team leaders and Leadership, ensuring timely follow-up and resolution.
Oversee and ensure the safe operation of all facilities equipment and appliances, including regular inspections to confirm everything is up to standard.
Manage and track the preventive maintenance schedule, ensuring all tasks are completed and proactively identifying potential issues before they arise.
Maintain the highest level of safety standards across all facilities operations, ensuring compliance with OSHA regulations and local laws.
Manage the vendor COIs (Certificates of Insurance) for all contractors, ensuring they are up to date and comply with company and building requirements.
Serve as the point of contact for facilities-related IT issues and work alongside IT teams to troubleshoot and resolve problems.
Communicate effectively with the Workplace Experience team to coordinate workspace and studio operations and maintain a high standard of member experience.
Assist with workplace-related projects and events as needed, supporting Pelotons mission of delivering an exceptional member and employee experience.

KEY SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Strong knowledge of facilities operations, including plumbing, electrical, HVAC systems, and building mechanical systems.
Ability to assign work orders to vendors for repairs and maintenance, ensuring tasks are completed on schedule and to the required standard.
Proven leadership skills, with the ability to mentor, train, and develop both new and existing team members.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks, inventory counts, and vendor relationships simultaneously.
High attention to detail, with the ability to monitor and maintain the cleanliness, functionality, and safety of studio spaces and offices.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to coordinate and collaborate with multiple departments and teams.
Knowledge of safety regulations, OSHA standards, and best practices for maintaining a safe and compliant workplace.
Ability to monitor and track preventive maintenance schedules and ensure all tasks are completed on time.
A proactive, solution-oriented attitude, committed to delivering an excellent workspace environment for employees and members.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a highly-motivated leader to join our growing SOX & Risk Assurance team, working primarily with our Precor business unit. This role will be responsible for operating as the Second Line of Defense within the Accounting Organization, establishing and maintaining policies and procedures that help monitor and enhance the companys global control environment and support management (First Line) in the identification of emerging risks. The SOX Manager will be a trusted business partner helping to design and optimize business processes and controls, while also operating as the primary liaison with internal audit (Third Line) and our external auditors on SOX compliance. The ideal candidate has a detailed knowledge of SOX and COSO framework, strong business process acumen, excellent communication and critical thinking skills, and an ability to collaborate effectively across a range of internal and external partners. This role offers a great opportunity to learn and grow within a high energy and innovative organization.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work within the Second Line of Defense (SOX) team, acting as an advisor to the business and driving the design, implementation and monitoring of Peloton's risk and control framework
Lead and manage all aspects of SOX work for a newly implemented and maturing SOX program for the Precor business with a sense of urgency - from planning, design, testing, reporting and remediation.
Develop and maintain/update process documentation, procedures and controls, including flowcharts and Risk and Control Matrices; document narratives as vital.
Conduct process walkthroughs and risk assessments, evaluating design effectiveness of key business process controls; if deficiencies are identified, partner with management to design appropriate remediation plans with feasible timelines and monitor remediation to completion.
Provide guidance and support to control owners if they propose process or system changes (e.g.implementation of new systems, impact assessment for changes in people, process or technology).
Provide timely and proactive updates to the SOX & Finance leadership team on key risks, gaps, process enhancements, or any areas of potential concern.
Prepare and provide regular training on SOX and control requirements, risk management, and other relevant areas (e.g. management review controls, IPE procedures, etc.) to educate business process owners and reiterate the importance of compliance
Partner with the IT SOX team to ensure alignment on SOX approach, timing, controls reliance, external audit reliance, etc.
Provide creative input that will drive process efficiency across the organization and make valuable contributions to the audit process.
Establish and maintain excellent relationships within the team and cross-functional teams.
Find opportunities to leverage IT solutions to automate processes and create efficiencies in financial processes and strengthen internal controls.
Coordinate activities and strategies with internal and external auditors.
Participate in the preparation of leadership and Audit Committee materials.
Perform other related special studies or projects as assigned, meeting deadlines.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

BA/BS degree in Accounting/Finance or related field. CPA, CIA, or CISA preferred.
5+ years of relevant Internal Audit or SOX experience
Mix of private and public accounting experience (assurance or advisory) at a Big 4 or national public accounting firm.
Strong business process acumen and knowledge of standard processes and best practice, with direct experience with Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Inventory and Financial Statement Close processes.
Working knowledge of IT systems - SAP, Salesforce, home grown systems, etc. and data analytics tools.
Highly organized, motivated, meticulous with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Flexible and able to adapt quickly in a fast-moving environment; able to easily manage competing priorities and deadlines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically to find solutions that meet compliance requirements while supporting business operations and objectives

Were looking for a strategic thinker with a passion for lifecycle marketing, proven retention expertise, and a deep understanding of the customer journey. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, is comfortable with cross-functional collaboration, and wants to make a tangible impact on member satisfaction and business growth.

Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure churn initiatives align with broader business goals, product updates, and member insights.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a skilled SOX ITGC Manager to lead our Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance efforts with a particular focus on User Access Review (UAR) controls and Identity Governance. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in IT general controls, risk management, and identity management frameworks. This role will be responsible for overseeing and managing the execution of the SOX User Access Review process to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations and company policies. This role requires a strong understanding of information security principles, regulatory requirements, and the ability to collaborate with external auditors, internal audit teams, and business leaders to ensure robust compliance with SOX controls and effective management of user access reviews. Identity Governance:Develop and maintain an identity governance framework to manage user identities, roles, and access rights across systems, ensuring least privilege access principles are adhered to.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, or a related experience.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT compliance, risk management, or audit, with a focus on SOX.
Proficient in ITGC frameworks, SOX requirements, and UAR controls.
Experience with UAR identity governance tools (Sailpoint, CyberArk)

Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CRISC) are a plus

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Data Scientist on the Product Analytics team to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our engagement products! This Data Scientist, Product will work as part of a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and User Researchers to better understand how members are interacting with Peloton products and to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product team. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 


Own analytics for one core workstream on Peloton digital apps, from metrics definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting, investigation, and generative research 


Be a key contributor to strategic decisions and roadmap formation for workstream


Collaborate with Product Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers to lead experimentation processes: designing and measuring A/B tests that help us understand the impact of new/alternate versions of features on user behavior


Define and own reporting and interpretation of KPIs & metrics for workstream, feature launches and A/B tests


Develop a deep understanding of user personas, fitness routines, and retention drivers for our members


Evaluate engagement trends across markets - compare workout/content engagement and feature usage among members within our growing global community


Become an authority on your workstream: provide insight into behaviors and difficulties of members on their journey from app download through sustained long-term engagement; help guide roadmap and evaluation of new features to enhance this user journey


Work in a lean and agile way, focusing on team members' desired outcomes over granular tasks and continuously assessing tradeoffs between precision and action-ability


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


BA/BS degree, preferably in a technical field


Have 3+ years of overall experience in an analytics capacity with a focus on problem-solving and providing concrete insights; some experience conducting analysis with a product/UX focus is desirable (an advanced degree may supply to years of experience)


Have solid technical skills when it comes to data wrangling and handling large datasets: can use SQL for data extraction (including sophisticated joins, CTE, window functions and query optimization), and have a proven understanding of Python syntax required for data cleaning and exploratory analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy)


Have experience with A/B testing and have demonstrated experience designing and assessing experiments


Have an understanding of statistics and data science methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, and other machine learning techniques such as clustering)


Have shown experience defining and owning project success metrics


Have a passion for data storytelling via decks and dashboards and a shown ability to efficiently communicate your insights to non-technical audiences and senior leadership


Are comfortable leading your project timelines, prioritizing tasks with user and business impact in mind, assessing speed/precision tradeoffs, and proactively communicating project statuses to collaborators and teammates


Work well collaboratively, both in a cross-functional context - with Product Managers, Project Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - and as a part of joint research projects with Product Analytics teammates


Are curious and humble: ask good questions, are always excited to learn new methods, approaches, and perspectives, and are eager to investigate interesting trends in the data 




Previous experience working on a product analytics team for a B2C software or software+hardware product


Solid understanding of event-based data collection and related technical concepts (e.g. SDK, device vs. cloud mode, schema management) and tools (e.g. Segment)


Experience with product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, etc.)


Experience with social engagement features/products, growth loops, network effects and product virality 


Understanding of adjacent quantitative and qualitative research methods and techniques (e.g. usability testing, concept testing, market sizing, etc.)

Title: Treasury Associate
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Peloton Treasury Team is looking for a talented treasury professional to join our team! The ideal candidate is a self-starter, analytical, attentive to detail, and highly organized. Moreover, the candidate is someone who consistently exceeds expectations and excels in quantitative and qualitative analytics. Having a solid foundation in Treasury and an interest in capital markets and macroeconomic trends is a plus. The Associate will support Pelotons banking activities, liquidity management and analytics, capital market reporting, maintenance of procedures, and support ad-hoc Treasury projects. The Associate will have the opportunity to regularly collaborate cross-functionally and quickly gain exposure to many areas of Treasury.

Collaborate internally and externally to ensure timely and accurate processing of Treasury payments, including wires and ACH, FX, and credit card activity.

Develop clear understanding of and interconnectivity between payment-related systems to resolve payment and reconciliation issues.

Support ad-hoc projects and reporting for insurance, T&E, and consumer finance workstreams.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
2-3 years relevant Treasury or finance experience.
Understanding of cash management, payment processes, and Treasury systems.
Experience with Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, conditional formatting).
Excellent analytical skills and ability to identify areas to improve processes.
Strong problem solving and decision-making skills with an analytical mindset.
Experience with FX and investment management concepts.
Familiarity with treasury management systems and ERP experience (Kyriba, Netsuite, etc.)
Familiarity with and interest in capital markets and macroeconomic analysis.
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple workstreams simultaneously.

Peloton is revolutionizing fitness with cutting-edge products and experiences that inspire millions to move. They guide teams in approaching problems with an agile mentality, ensuring rapid iteration on both UX and UI while maintaining a high bar for design quality. We believe great design isnt just about executionits about creating experiences that inspire, motivate, and empower people to live healthier lives.
Successful candidates are self-motivated, strategic, and highly collaborative leaders. They proactively drive projects forward, provide mentorship and feedback, and create an environment where designers can do their best work. They cultivate a team culture rooted in support, curiosity, and continuous growthlifting each other up, pushing the work forward, and celebrating wins together. They prioritize the success of the team over individual contributions and take ownership of delivering impactful outcomes.Note: Please ensure you include a link to a live portfolio or a downloadable PDF of work samples in your application. Itll be our first introduction to your user-centered product design experience and visual/interaction design skills.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead and mentor a team of product designers, fostering a culture of deep thinking, innovation and collaboration. 
Define and drive the design vision in alignment with company objectives, ensuring our work is both impactful and deeply user-centered.
Lead design strategy and guide execution across a range of projects, focusing on our most complex feature sets that merge hardware with data-driven intelligence. 
Ensure the team delivers high-quality, impactful design solutions that sweat the details. Ability to roll up your sleeves and help the team get work over the finish line. 
Partner closely with Product, Engineering, UXR, and Analytics teams to align design goals with business and user needs.
Advocate for design thinking across the organization and drive alignment on design approaches.
Optimize workflows and design operations to increase efficiency and impact. Establish and implement best practices for prototyping, design artifacts, and interaction logic.
Champion user research and data-driven decision-making to inform design solutions, ensuring we are always putting our users first.
Advocate for accessibility and inclusivity in design, making sure our products serve and uplift a diverse range of users.
Provide coaching, feedback, and career development support to the team as well as hiring top design talent, ensuring a thriving and motivated team culture.
Oversee contributions to the companys design system, standardizing cross-functional workflows and ensuring consistency across products.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

8+ years of experience designing for product experiences, with at least 5 years in a leadership role managing designers.
Strong portfolio showcasing end-to-end design processes as well as examples that demonstrate strong outcomes from your design leadership.
You excel in influencing product direction and thrive when aligning your teams work with organizational goals.
Excel at coaching designers to level up UX, UI, and Content Design craft while fostering an environment of continuous learning.
Proficiency in modern design tools (Figma a must) and prototyping software.
Adept at fostering cross-functional collaboration and resolving challenges before they arise, ensuring work remains exciting and rewarding.
Known for driving inclusivity and engagement within teams that leads to a positive workplace culture.
Experience in mentorship, hiring, and cultivating talent, for all levels of IC designers. 
Passion for fitness, technology, and using design to create meaningful, connected experiences that empower people to live healthier, more active lives.

Title: Manager, Data Foundations
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we treat Data as a Product - a valuable asset and a critical piece of our decision making process. The Data Foundations team is responsible for providing several capabilities:

Persistence for all client and service data, across multiple persistence solutions (PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, Redshift, Kafka, and graph databases).
Ingestion services, client libraries, and access patterns for all our operational persistence.
Retrieval services and libraries, caching services, and front-end infrastructure for engineering teams to understand and consume operational data.
Processing and routing pipelines that ensure privacy and compliance policies as data flows through the enterprise at the speed the business demands.

We are looking for an engaged, hands-on Engineering Manager to join our Data Foundations team to build and provide leadership across all four capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a passion for quality code and architecture, and will provide technical leadership as well as individual technical contribution as part of a team.Your team will be solving a wide range of problems related to data protection and security, observability across the entire ecosystem, and ensure the systems your build and support are highly available, secure, and provide the throughput our Members and Team Members demand. Our Members trust us to keep their data safe and secure, and youll play a key role in earning and keeping that trust, from guidance and implementation of data classification and retention policies, and ensuring sensitive data is protected and anonymized appropriately throughout the entire data lifecycle. As a people leader you will be responsible for career development and growth of your engineers, ensuring that they are motivated in doing their best work in line with their interests.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Staff and manage a team of engineers responsible for the Data Foundations, from data ingestion and routing, and meet all SLOs and SLAs for the products your team owns.
Be focused on eliminating toil within your team and your own customers through self-service tooling, and internally developed and published libraries for all the products you own.
Represent the Data Foundations team in internal customer meetings, cross functional workstreams,  maintain roadmaps for the team, help prioritize customer requests and drive iterative delivery of projects enabling our stakeholders to be successful. 
Establish team level performance indicators to measure efficiency of the teams output and impact to the Team Members we support.
Inspire a healthy, collaborative, empathetic engineering culture in line with Pelotons values, helping your team develop and grow along the engineering journey at Peloton.
Ensure that data pipelines are implemented with quality and observability included, along with appropriate encryption and tokenization techniques.
Partner closely with our security teams, ensuring logging and auditing mechanisms are in place and responding to any security incidents around the data infrastructure your teams support.
Champion engineering and operational excellence, drive database reliability and incident management by establishing metrics and processes for assessment and improvements.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

8+ years of software development experience in the data platform and datastores disciplines. You should be familiar with the inner workings of a data pipeline, understand the difference between streaming and batch processing data pipelines, and understand how a database engine builds a query plan.
Demonstrable experience in operating and supporting infrastructure within a cloud environment like AWS. Familiarity with orchestration tools like Kubernetes, and data orchestration services like Glue, Data Lake Formations, and Airflow is a plus.
Direct, hands-on experience in operating and managing a highly available datastore in production cloud environments (preferably AWS), such as PostgreSQL or MySQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, or Kafka. Your team supports many different storage solutions, and familiarity with at least one is strongly preferred.
An understanding of the tradeoffs between data encryption and tokenization mechanisms, and how to manage the performance tradeoffs between them.
Prior experience managing and growing individual contributors. Your feedback and coaching is critical to the success of your Team Members.
Experience with Python or Scala (or comparable high-level language) and experience working on large distributed systems and frameworks like Spark / Flink for data pipelines.
You have a product mindset - focused on working with internal customers, prioritizing projects and iteratively delivering customer value.
The ability to identify strength and weakness of individuals in order to maximize team effectiveness and provide guidance to individuals when needed for coaching or mentoring.
The ability and experience to mediate between competing product and technical priorities and align priorities and goals through collaboration with technical leads and product managers.
Passion for building stable and secure systems management practices.
You are pragmatic without compromising on software quality and standards.

Title: Sr. Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer, Backend, Personalization
RoleDescription:
The Role
The Personalization team at Peloton is looking for a senior machine learning infrastructure engineer to design, build and maintain low latency and highly scalable content recommendations services for our super engaged members across multiple platforms. You will have a unique opportunity to build systems and services to provide real time recommendations and best in-class experience for the worlds leading at home fitness platform. You will work closely with other ML Engineers, API Engineers and Product Managers to drive and test new ML product features. Were looking for someone whos passionate about fitness, and is excited about the challenges of unlocking the power of machine learning in a production environment. 
Responsibilities

Design and build Python microservices that power Pelotons content recommendations.
Work closely with ML engineers to productionize models efficiently, ensuring seamless integration with backend services.
Productionize, deploy and monitor Personalization/machine learning services.
Ensure high availability and performance of backend services through load balancing, caching strategies, and auto-scaling techniques.
Assume technical responsibility for Personalization services, and work with engineers to scale and improve testability of our production systems.
Conduct capacity planning and performance tuning to support high-traffic personalization workloads.
Collaborate and work closely with our platform teams to leverage their tools and infrastructure to rapidly iterate on ideas that drive delightful personalized experiences for millions of users.

Required Qualifications

B.S. Degree in Computer Science/Engineering and 5+ years of experience in Software Engineering.
Strong understanding of software engineering principles and fundamentals including data structures and algorithms.
Experience writing code in Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, C/C++ with documentation for reproducibility.
Strong experience deploying and managing services on AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Experience with message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS) to handle real-time event-driven architectures.
Proficiency in debugging, profiling, and tuning backend services (e.g., using flame graphs, p99 latency tracking).
Proficiency with relational and non-relational databases such as Postgres, MySQL, DynamoDB, Redis.
Experience with designing RESTful API. 
Experience working with gRPC and designing microservices from ground up.
Experience with concurrency and parallelism in Python and/or Java.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience/Interest working in at least one of following ML disciplines: recommender systems, natural language processing or computer vision.
Experience with Redis, Memcached, and CDN strategies to optimize recommendation response times.
Experience analyzing cloud costs and optimizing infrastructure spend without sacrificing reliability.
Experience with building real-time ML applications with NVIDIA Triton/TorchServe.
Experience working with Graph Databases (Neo4j).
Have experience in building secure consumer facing APIs.
Have experience in leading backend development and engineering. 
Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations.
Experience working with docker, orchestration platforms like kubernetes, CI/CD workflows like GHA and other IaC tools like Terraform, cloud formation etc.
Experience with ML Monitoring and Observability tools like Datadog, MLFlow, Grafana etc.

Title: Senior Product Designer, App
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Senior Product Designer to help create simple, elegant, and intuitive experiences on our Digital Apps (iOS, Android, TV Apps, and Web). 
Our Senior Product Designers create complex and functionality-dense interfaces across various ecosystems and interaction patterns across different screen sizes. They design in non-linear terms: capturing interactions, edge-cases, and the various states of these experiences through deliverables such as user flows, product maps, wireframes, storyboards, and prototypes. They approach problems with an agile mentality and rapidly iterate on both the UI and UX of the projects.
As a Senior Product Designer, youll partner closely with content designers,  product managers, user researchers, engineers, project managers, and other cross-functional teams to bring features to life across our Digital Apps requiring you to work in an agile development process.
Successful candidates are self-motivated, strategic, highly collaborative, proactive project owners, readily open to feedback and critique. They value the success of the team over their individual progress, and are often taking leadership over delivering outcomes.
Portfolio requiredplease include a live link or downloadable PDF showcasing your user-centered design work, interaction design skills, and problem-solving approach.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Create UX and UI for a range of projects across multiple strategic App work-streams, designing end-to-end experiences for our most complex feature sets
Design intuitive, innovative, and polished UI that is consistent with the brand and products existing UI
Work in close partnership with Content Designer and the Product Manager on your work-stream to fulfill product initiatives
Create detailed user flows, product maps, wireframes, etc., communicating UX clearly to relevant teams
Prototype user experiences and work with UX Research to coordinate and run tests with end users
Manage priorities and tradeoffs by quickly iterating on designs based on feedback from peers or from learnings found in user testing 
Collaborate on systemic initiatives, such as the design system, to enhance cross-platform cohesion and efficiency
Capture all states, edge-cases, unhappy paths and path logic for engineering teams to build out
Design with engineering implementation and cross-platform consistency in mind
Provide prototypes/deliverables to describe interactions and motion
Execute UI from exploration/concept to final pixel perfect hand-off to engineering
QA developed software for visual accuracy, and provide detailed feedback to engineering towards revisions until product launch

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

6+ years of Software Product Design experience at consumer-focused technology companies
Comfortable working with ambiguous requirements and ability to quickly adapt and flex on direction of projects
Proven record of bringing features to life from conception to production in a compressed time frame
Highly attentive to detail and ability to conceptualize multi-state, multi-path interaction systems and to consistently capture edge-cases
Exceptional design velocity: ability and willingness to quickly produce multiple concepts.
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Iterative approach to product design, ensuring a unified experience across the board
Cognitive awareness of wider business goals, delivering intuitive and user-centered design solutions
Focused and dedicated to how software products function and how users move through the experience to accomplish their goals
Experience working closely with product, analytics, user research and engineers to develop and iterate on interactive software experiences
Experience designing for a variety of screen sizes and platforms: for fully responsive web experiences and/or for mobile (touch-device) apps
Familiarity with the design systems, interaction patterns, and limitations of cross functional platforms - specifically Android, iOS, and web apps
Proficient with Figma, Principle and other design and prototyping tools.
Experience working with and contributing to UI design libraries and style guides

Previously designed for IOS/Android experiences
Designed experiences on larger touch screens and/or TV interfaces
Experience in prototyping UI interactivity and in incorporating motion/animation into UI
